channel.title: Your favourite operating system?
channel.description: I like Linux, but I'm using Windows Xp Professional at the moment, because I don't want to screw up my windows partition again! I tried once and I accidentally killed my Windows partition :(

item.title: Your favourite operating system?
item.dc:creator: @O_M_F_G O M F G
item.description:
@O_M_F_G wrote:

I’ve tried Linux, mac and all the other shit
Windows I like best cuz I’m used 2 it, but if I was to use a mac for 2months I’d prob like mac best…

Read full topic

item.title: Your favourite operating system?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Goat Spirit, post:49, topic:30043”][quote author=juju link=topic=44016.msg588672#msg588672 date=1165640238]

I already said, Linux is insecure as hell. Windows might be buggy, but linux is even worse!

It’s free. If every single hacker will try to crack linux, we’ll be finished within 1 minute. It’s free -> crappy.

Linux is developed by “hackers”, it’s also developed for love, not for the money, which means a overall better product. Windows still doesn’t encourage users to login as a non-administrator for day to day use.

Also, why would a free product be any worse than a paid product? There are more developers working on Linux, Unix has been around much longer than Windows - which Linux is heavily based on, and, as I said above, it’s developed for love.

Security through obscurity isn’t much security at all!
[/quote]
Linux is not made by hackers. I make a shit load of money for doing Linux stuff also, so you could say it’s profitable, even though it’s open source. :)[/quote]

Of course Linux is made by hackers…

Read full topic

item.title: Your favourite operating system?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

I’ve used Mac, Linux, and Windows. I’d definetly have to say that Linux is my favorite (RedHat, and Ubuntu). But I use Windows XP Pro, because of the software. Think about it, you go on the internet to share information, ideas, chat, and download programs. About 5%, if that of the software made in the world is for Linux. If there was a program that could convert .exe to .tgz, I’d use Linux.

Read full topic

Also, why would a free product be any worse than a paid product? There are more developers working on Linux, Unix has been around much longer than Windows - which Linux is heavily based on, and, as I said above, it’s developed for love.

Security through obscurity isn’t much security at all![/quote]

item.title: Your favourite operating system?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I can see what you mean, with the problem that with Open Source it is easier to find vulnerabilities. However, did you ever consider that with Linux, by the time these vulnerabilities hit the knowledge of the masses, they have already been patched? Most “hackers” get their vulns from Buqtraq and the likes, and the millions of developers working towards the project have already patched it before it gets on there - compared to Microsofts months before any real security update is found.

Also, there are fundamental flaws in Windows’ design which creates security issues, not just bugs in applications. Linux does not have these. (Well, not all of them)

Read full topic
